abstract.p: Benjamin C Stanczyk letter on Eve Schaenen's March 12 travel article on Krakow notes city is one of Europe's best preserved because it had no military or industrial value to the Kaiser or Hitler (S) /// 55 NYT 05 28 00 0005 00018 5 37 I LR 415952 KRAKOW HISTORY***Benjamin C Stanczyk letter on Eve Schaenen's March 12 travel article on Krakow notes Polish city is one of Europe's best preserved because it held no military or industrial value to the Kaiser or Hitler (S)

block.p: To the Editor: Eve Schaenen gave us an inspiring and informative history in ''Krakow Maintains Its Regal Mien'' (March 12). That city was spared by both the Kaiser and Hitler because it had no military value and no industry. As a result, it is one of the best preserved cities of Europe.

To the Editor: Eve Schaenen gave us an inspiring and informative history in ''Krakow Maintains Its Regal Mien'' (March 12). That city was spared by both the Kaiser and Hitler because it had no military value and no industry. As a result, it is one of the best preserved cities of Europe.

Recently a group of Felician nuns returned from Krakow after a summer at the Jagiellonian University expressing utter amazement that their dormitory had been built before Columbus came to America. And my grandson could not believe that he was eating in a restaurant, Wierzy nek's, housed in a building dated 1512.
